documents.document: @NewtonMark In many facets of life, we go beyond the bare minimum to ensure understanding and safety. A few sticker… https://t.co/r66m2QZlGd
@NewtonMark Some ideas: a sticker that says "Exit to ground and roof only" or a painted arrow-line in the corridors leading to street.
@NewtonMark If this we'e software, you'd log this as an interface bug. After it killed someone, you'd mark it as very high priority.
@NewtonMark That's not a solid position when you consider the other two people mentioned.
@adamliaw @EllieCK For all their many flaws, the denizens of Mackay had wonderful baggage carousel etiquette last time I was there.
@Dan_Stan8 @annikasmethurst 276 sets (+1 more from today, I guess) https://t.co/r5LHTyh0Zb
@AmandaDevaus I will be trying Big W and city Target on way home tonight. Belconnen stores had none on account of weather.
@AmandaDevaus Spoke too soon. They're all out of normal pedestal fans. Double boo.
@AmandaDevaus Absolutely. And a boo for my pedestal fan that died last night. Fortunately Bunnings is open right now.
Cloudless #Canberra sky from near Mt Painter. https://t.co/EXVSgAmhLK
Literally not a cloud in the sky today in #Canberra. I predict it's gonna be a hot one.
@Tribesports Excellent. Well, I'm going to make myself look like a pro-athlete.
@jaybirdsport And if you want to follow-up, please see emails of 9/Oct/16 and 21/Jan/17 and Twitter DMs of 18/Oct/16 and 15/Nov/16.
My review of @jaybirdsport Freedom Wireless headphones (won on @RunningHeroesAU): -Broke after 30 minutes -Support never responded Cheers. 👍
@Tribesports Would parkrun club shirts survive ironing for 30 seconds to apply iron-on name transfer?
@dannolan Ever think maybe he knows more about pens than you, punk?
@sausageeyeroll I got told to smile by an man in 2004. It was weird/invasive enough I remember it still. Sorry this happens often to women.
An act to make the Australian citizenship pledge just singing along to Powderfinger - My Happiness and for related purposes. #AustraliaDay
I would support the changing of the date of Australia Day to an alternative date. #AustraliaDay
@dannolan Train to Leicharp or Harperfield? <puns exhausted>
@dennis118118 @DoctorKarl Theoretically, yes. It's very hot. https://t.co/aqHVtUhkGA

@Telstra Thanks. Was the latter (an email with details of an offer) so I could get the details and consider. Didn't get their C/D# though.
@Telstra Are calls from 0862284190 from Telstra/subcontractor? They had *all* of my acct details but didn't send email with details of offer
Call me skeptical, but following "there are no estimates" with "biggest crowd ever" seems suspicious. 🤔 https://t.co/Klt5n2T0LY
@nascom1 @Voyager I spend the whole day wondering what MAGROL meant. Now I realise it's magnetometer roll - a thin… https://t.co/aht0tmUT7K
@NewtonMark If the 20th century has taught us anything, it's that we're obliged to fight Nazis.
Glorious summer day in #Canberra. ☀️Time to head out to @CanberraDSN for a spot of chatting to the public about space and stuff. 📡📡📡📡🚀
Just completed a 5.12 km run - Hooray to be back at @gindyparkrun #parkrun https://t.co/YD0z1tG0MY #Runkeeper
And we have power back on in Belconnen Town Centre. #canberra
Widespread power outages in Northside #Canberra. Weirdly, both blocks either side of my complex have lights.
@akent Possibly so they can track it down in case they lose it. Mine usually describes the fabric appearance (eg "blue grey striped").
No matter what you do, you will never be happier than this guy watching Emirates's in-flight live TV. https://t.co/xWorlW7Ivi
✈ MEL → CBR on VH-VXD as QF812 in 18A. Last flight and then I'm home. Grateful for @Qantas rebooking flights after flight landed very late.
It's great to be back in Australia.
✈ SIN → MEL ( → CBR) on A6-EOV as EK404 in 56C. The A380 is so big I'm surprised physics lets it fly.
Allow me to relate the chaos that arises when pax of two A380s are screened simultaneously at the same point: chaos. Such a huge aeroplane.
✈ DXB → SIN → MEL on A6-EOV as EK404 in 57J. Showered, fed, and back on my way.
@Qantas Someone's gotta sit in the bad seat. It wasn't great but I made it out the other side.
@NewtonMark Nice cross promotion there with the bacon and egg roll.
Toledo ravine and river. #toledo #spain #landscape @ Toledo, Spain https://t.co/2Jsd1dt9rn
Don Quixote path around Toledo. #spain #toledo @ Toledo, Spain https://t.co/nFBaoauvOO
Lighted window in Toledo. #toledo #spain #cobblestone @ Toledo, Spain https://t.co/jIZhZbpKvV
Turns out I'm sitting in the worst seat on the plane. Such are the pains of codeshares. My @Qantas status means nothing this far from home.
✈ BCN → DXB ( → SIN → MEL → CBR) on A6-ENL in 50B. End of my Spain trip.
@In_The_Taratory If it is available on Android, Hyperlapse (by Instagram) does a similar thing with smoothing.
@KetanJ0 Hmmm yes, batteries. <brushes concerns about variability, need to diversify renewable mix and frequency control away>
Rogue One: Finally! A uniform for all these pens I have to carry around.
@realcanberra I saw a functioning video rental store in Melbourne. Also I think there's one in Belconnen still, near the post office.
@smadge1 Not at all. I am out and about to see the city!
Cordoba, 3°C, Public holiday = total ghost town. Only people out are the tourists.
@KetanJ0 Having letterboxes for a politician, I hate the two to the left. The one on right (Stanton) is OK but not great.
@RicharddFox Where is "Just slightly over the speed limit"?
@sister_ratched Visited the Centro Cultural CajaGranada yesterday and immediately throughly of you. Was a wonderful… https://t.co/2Y306LR9A0
Streamed this in a bar in Málaga, Spain. https://t.co/uhARr0xHsZ
@TrishHepworth @In_The_Taratory In comparison to Canberra, Spain is awash in smoke. Where is your experience from? Spain also?
@In_The_Taratory I feel exactly the same about all of Spain. So many smokers, in all contexts, brazenly lighting up.
Feliz año neuvo from Spain. I've eaten my 12 grapes (unfortunately with seeds) and I'm ready for bed.
@In_The_Taratory Definitely sound like Canadians.
@rachsmithtweets I did it at a time when there wasn't health data available. Genetic sequence + origins hasn't been as useful as I hoped.
@thomas_violence I'm on holiday in Europe and it has changed. https://t.co/Jyj0G9iLQy
Took a tumble jogging on Barcelonan sidewalks, with a long cold hobble home. Ankle should be fine before tomorrow's jog. (I hope.)
@OMGTheMess Have a great day denying climate change, or whatever your agenda is.
@OMGTheMess Then you're wasting your time arguing on the internet. Go do something with your knowledge.
@OMGTheMess Climate change (causes and effects) is very complex and deserves a helicopter view. Anything I post will be argued with by you.
@OMGTheMess Here is a good starter from the Australian Academy of Science: https://t.co/NhYCndYIDr
@OMGTheMess Climate change is a worrisome phenomena. Moreso when we *know* the cause is us. Even moreso when we dither on addressing it.
@OMGTheMess I recognise the existence of the medieval warm period (MWP) and accept it happened.
@OMGTheMess Can't really review this as I can't access the correction.
@dannolan @bencubby Scariest single sentence I've read in a log time.
@OMGTheMess Happy to see the info you can provide. WWW links best.
@OMGTheMess Happy to see the info you can provide. WWW links best. Reputable sources only thanks.
@OMGTheMess @bencubby Happy to see this info. WWW links best. Also would appreciate your assessment of the progenitor's reputation.
@OMGTheMess Happy to see this info. WWW links best. Also would appreciate your assessment of the progenitor's reputation (eg as %age).
@OMGTheMess Happy to see the evidence, howsoever recorded or determined. As long as it's from a reputable source.
@OMGTheMess During human habitation of the Earth? Or at a time when fundamentally different things were happening? Also what of the delta-t?
@OMGTheMess @bencubby OK. Ben's statement is true, though our evidence for it comes not from written info, but from analysis of physical.
@OMGTheMess @bencubby Correct and incorrect. Writing permits it but does not guarantee it. More usual form is "since temp records began".
@MarkusMannheim @TrishHepworth I was there a few weeks ago and they already had a 2017-dated coin for sale. (Richie Benaud one.)
@OMGTheMess @bencubby This is not inconsistent with the definition, noting those seem to be proto-writing unable to store/convey much info
@OMGTheMess @bencubby Recorded history = while writing systems used by humans, allowing history to be contemporaneously recorded.
We're not flying over Egypt. Looks like we're going over Turkey, which has far fewer pyramids.
✈ DXB → BCN on A6-EEH as EK185 in seat 50A. Here's hoping we fly the Cairo route and I get to see the pyramids.
Dubai business lounge is very interesting. People from everywhere as the embodiment of "It's five o'clock somewhere" - champagne at 6:30am.
✈ BNE → DXB ( → BCN) on A6-EEF as EK435 in 70A. Hello again A380!
✈ MKY → BNE ( → DXB → BCN) on VH-QOX as QF2517 in seat 1A. BRB, going to Spain.
Shame to hear about George Michael. Last Christmas, he gave me his heart. Not sure what I did with it, and we sort of grew apart afterwards.
@dethfrmabve @DoctorKarl Inwould guess it depends on how the biomass is stored. Not locked away if the grass composts.
"Why do they make it so hard to get into products these days?" - My mum as she removes the single 4cm piece of tape on a Fitbit box.
Merry Christmas everyone. Stay out of the sun, and have a crisp cold one. Cheers.
Q: What do you cal a crazy golfer? A: A crack putt. #crackerjokes
Q: Why can't a bicycle stand up by itself? A: Because it's two tired. #crackerjokes
Q: What's the most popular gardening magazine? A: Weeder's Digest. #crackerjokes
Q: Why do birds fly south in winter? A: Because it's too far to walk. #crackerjokes
Q: Why don't ducks tell jokes while flying? A: Because they would quack up. #crackerjokes
Q: How does Jack Frost get to work? A: By icicle. #crackerjokes
Q: How do monkeys make toast? A: They stick some bread under the gorilla. #crackerjokes
Q: What do hedgehogs eat? A: Prickled onions. #crackerjokes
Q: How did the cannonball lose its job? A: He got fired. #crackerjokes
Q: What has a bed but does not sleep and a mouth but does not speak? A: A river. #crackerjokes
